Echo the opening at the end. Avoid verbatim lines; limit canonical words.
poem:
**The Snagglesnore of Underpass Glum**

Beware the murkous undergleam,  
Where quickle-snicks go brabble-wyn:  
Dreer-damp and dribble-dim it seem—  
Yon echo-tunnels pine.  

Fetch firmybats and flickerboots,  
Don swizzle-helm and skeeve,  
For naught but whirly-wimpled hoots  
Swarm round at shadow's leave.  

The Snagglesnore with hackle-hide  
Came clatter-hush, cree-ick and plap,  
Its flustermaw gaped, wide aside—  
A breath of shadow-snap!  

Blarple! With skreek and scramble-flit  
My blintherblade went swash and shoon,  
One twiddle-whack, a thunk-split hit—  
The echo met its doom.  

Now home I skip on jibbly feet  
Past underpass and glum,  
The flickle-tunes are sprangle-sweet—  
No more the Snagglesnore drum.  

And still the murkous undergleam  
Dreams blabble-wyn and brabble-wyn:  
No hackle-echoes snag my dream  
’Neath echo-tunnel pine.
label: high

poem:
**Slithermist and the Mawjibog**

Snootheling in the glimbleglade,  
The whipplewhirlings twined,  
Beware the Mawjibog, I said,  
His fumblefangs aligned!  
The ploddlepeats went tick-tock-tack  
Where murkgobs muffled dawn,  
And whoozlecrakes in flutterpacks  
Kept bothersome and drawn.

So sharn my whibbleweather boots,  
And clasket up my brain,  
I donned my fogwind buttoned suits  
Against the slurkling rain.  
With blifflebelts and croodlebright,  
I snatched my dappling stave—  
No morning-mizzle Mawjibite  
Would drag me to his cave!

A wubble—shush!—in bubble-gray,  
The flindlefronds went quill,  
Gulplunk! The Mawjibog did sway  
With groother-grim and chill.  
I bumbled forth, my courage sprong,  
With staff a-whap and yowl!  
By dwindle-gloss and warbler-song  
I gave his nose a howel!

His snarflewail, a rattle-scree,  
Went trizzling through the mire,  
Yet still he gnommled after me  
With blizzletufted ire!  
But swush! my dappler clockle-bent,  
And flackered snout did bruise—  
The Mawjibog was giddlenessed,  
His fogbones fit to lose.

Back over snootheling glimbleglade,  
Past ploddlepeat and pong,  
The wildamorn in gurfling shade  
Now rang with fartyong’s song.  
The Mawjibog so clobberdone,  
His gloomle stops at bay—  
With whipplewhirling whoop begun,  
The jinky world grew day.
label: high

poem:
**Blizzlewump Returns**

'Twas blinny-bright, the gildertides  
Befrumbled through the groves;  
All gnibblewise, with spiraltides,  
The blizzlewump-beasts roved.  
Bewibble, child, the glimmercrooks—  
Beware the nak-nak tune!  
Their snitching steps in flicker-nooks  
Foretell a fate too soon.

With yibblecloak and tumblebell  
He swervled through the dusk;  
His nacklebride, a thrumbling shell,  
Entwinked in whisper-musk.  
Oh flick and flint, the dinder-dissed—  
His heart-pump wibble-won!  
He dreams of days just twist-and-twist  
Where echo-echoes run.

Then—snicker-snap!—the blizzlewump,  
All brattle-whirl and glare,  
Burst skibber-crisp from hollow bump  
Upon the shimmerstair!  
Gnarb, it cried, with yodel-yap,  
Its veezle-fangs agleam;  
He swizzled forth, ker-thwack, ker-clap!  
And split the blitzy dream.

He spindled back through fuzzle-fair,  
His jingle-tale adored;  
Each splindle-eye and stargold stare  
Did giddlenap their lord.  
So sniffle-soft, the gildertides  
Reswirled beneath the moon—  
Yet somewhere, still, the blizzlewides  
Forewarn a creebling soon.
label: high

poem:
**Drimbly-Wrythe and the Pishferloo**

Twibby the turf in murklemorn,  
Where slinklepaws desire lay,  
The plodgers warn of dirdleworn —  
“Beware the wibble-way!”

Sapwisp runs twined with bramblethin,  
Slip-scrench and squabble-poofs ahead,  
Flimfoot and sprattle, pack within,  
And don your glindle-thread.

Nurdle-eyed, the Pishferloo springs,  
With waggawomp and fangle-glee,  
Its snilder tongue and whomple wings  
Go gluck-gluck up the scree!

“Whiffling wild!” brave Drimbly cried,  
With swindle-braid both strong and long,  
He jabber-hopped and shentrified  
That beast with sprungle song!

Zammer-flap! The talons thunk!  
Croosh-croosh the tussled tremble-ground!  
Briggle, braggle, till Pishferloo shrunk,  
Then trilled its wither-sound.

Homeward through the warpety watt,  
With jangle-praise and spiggle-cheer,  
He twibby-trudged the turfy slot,  
The wish-path bright and clear.

Twibby the turf in murklemorn,  
Where slinklepaws desire lay,  
No plodger fears the dirdleworn—  
“Stride up the wibble-way!”
label: high

poem:
**Confurble-Roomery**

’Twas briefle-bright, the braster walls  
Did flickle-flack with chatter-sheen;  
Fribbling forth through hallways halls,  
The Grapplebun skritched unseen.

Bewary be!—the clatter-curse  
Of Grapplebun with jargle-jaws!  
Bewidge your notes and check-rehearse,  
Lest blunderbrim befalls.

He took his bold-formumptous chart—  
The wamble-whisk, the whuddle-pen—  
And dodged the guggle-grumble smart  
Of tasklists, ten by ten.

And as in puzzled dritch he thunked,  
The Grapplebun, with meeting-moan,  
In flipfump fits, his fuzzle trunked,  
And plopped upon the phone.

Splash! went the sloggle-mutter;  
Crash! fell the scribble-sprays.  
Quick with a jabber-pointer, up flutter,  
He met that beast ablaze!

One hackle-vote, two baffle-plotz—  
He out-swayed sly suggestion slime!  
The Grapplebun snarfled notes to dots:  
Consensus! Tulip time!

Back through briefle-bright he strode,  
Confurblers cheered with sniggly tunes.  
The fribbling flack, anew bestowed,  
Crowned peace upon those rooms.

’Twas briefle-bright, the braster walls  
Did flickle-flack with chatter-sheen;  
Meeting-tamed in hallway halls—  
No Grapplebun, but dreams convene.
label: high
